title: Liberal Housing Policy
author: Doc Riter
summary: The Center for American Progress's 'Rent Relief for Reform' plan exemplifies why liberal housing solutions fail: they bribe existing homeowners rather than trusting market signals and property rights.

title: California's $18B Problem
author: Doc Riter
summary: California faces an $18 billion budget deficit in 2026-27, larger than anticipated despite revenue improvements. The state's fiscal resilience tools are nearly exhausted, and AI-fueled stock market gains mask structural spending problems.

title: Cox v. Sony
author: Doc Riter
summary: Supreme Court examines whether Cox Communications can be held liable for copyright infringement by its subscribers in landmark case testing the boundaries of secondary liability

title: SF MAHA
author: Doc Riter
summary: San Francisco City Attorney files lawsuit against eleven major food manufacturers alleging they designed ultra-processed foods to be addictive and deliberately targeted children, fueling epidemics of obesity, diabetes, and fatty liver disease.

title: RoboTaxis
author: Doc Riter
summary: City council members across US cities including Boston, Minneapolis, and Washington D.C. oppose autonomous robotaxis over job displacement concerns and safety questions.

title: Slaughter v. Trump
author: Doc Riter
summary: Supreme Court oral argument examining constitutional limits on presidential power and statutory interpretation in landmark case with implications for executive authority.

title: Hamm v. Smith
author: Doc Riter
summary: Supreme Court oral argument examining the application of IQ test scores and adaptive functioning evidence in determining whether a death row inmate is intellectually disabled under the Eighth Amendment

title: Reparations
author: Doc Riter
summary: SF File 240701 creates a Reparations Fund as a category-four fund to receive appropriated or donated dollars; it sets the budget/legal mechanism but does not appropriate a specific amount.

title: War Bill
author: Doc Riter
summary: NDAA FY2026 Navy shipbuilding authorization from $20.84B requested to $30.96B, including $6.34B for DDGâ€“51 and $5.40B in labeled workforce/shipyard enhancements.

title: Noncitizen SNAP Participants
author: Doc Riter
summary: In fiscal year 2023, 68,000 noncitizens collected SNAP benefits in Massachusetts - 6.27% of the state's total SNAP participation. Analysis of citizenship composition, age demographics, state variation, and administrative challenges including Massachusetts's 14% payment error rate.

title: Congress Completes All 12 FY2026 Appropriations Bills
author: Doc Riter
summary: Congress officially completed all 12 fiscal year 2026 appropriations measures with $1.6 trillion in discretionary spending. Includes DOGE-backed reforms with 10% federal workforce reduction, $11.7B IRS rescissions, and strategic investments in defense and homeland security.
